description: From the Watagans Headquarters this walk follows a section of the Great North Walk
through the Watagans National Park that is harder to get to and far less travelled than the Sydney end.
After looping around the rural Congewai Valley amongst the cattle, the walk trails a narrow ridgeline with many incidental lookouts.

markers.description: From the campground follow the Great North Walk down Watagan Forest Road towards Hunter Valley and turn left down Georges Road.
From the left side of Georges Road follow the rough and steep Congewai Creek Walking Track down into the gully.
At the bottom of the gully cross Congewai Creek and continue down the bushtrail.
After the bushtrail opens up to pastures, follow the dirt road up the valley.
At the Great North Walk sign, cross the fence over the ladder and follow the signs up the ridge to a campground.
From the campground follow the Great North Walk sign towards Watagan Forest HQ.
+ 0.5h / 2km A short side trip down Lookout Track leads to a vantage point over Congewai Valley.
Further down the trail, the ridge narrows until there are steep drops on either side.
From the aptly named Narrow Place Lookout close the loop back to Watagan Headquarters.
+ 0.1h / 0.5km Along the way another short side trip to the left leads to an unfenced lookout across Hunter Valley.
